headline: Fred Silverman, a Force On TV When 3 Networks  Reigned, Is Dead at 82
abstract: A top executive at CBS, ABC and then NBC, he shepherded series like “All in the Family,” “Laverne & Shirley” and “Hill Street Blues.”
lead_paragraph: Fred Silverman, who as a top executive at CBS, ABC and finally NBC was one of the most powerful people in the three-network era — a force behind the success of beloved series like “All in the Family,” “The Mary Tyler Moore Show,” “M*A*S*H,” “Laverne & Shirley” and “Hill Street Blues” — died on Thursday at his home in the Pacific Palisades section of Los Angeles. He was 82.
